paragraphs: Deforestation amounted to 326.93 sq km in the Legal Amazon in March 2020, according to data from the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
Compared to the previous month, there was a 76% increase in deforestation rate.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cutting, which removes all vegetation, responsible for 317.72 sq km of deforested area.
Pará was the most affected state, where 122.11 sq km were deforested.
Altamira (in the state of Pará) was the most deforested municipality (77.03 sq km) in the month.
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the Jamanxim National Forest, state of Pará, where 3.24 sq km of forest were chopped out.

paragraphs: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 1,450.64 sq km were chopped out of the legal Amazon in September 2019.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which completely clears the soil of vegetation, responsible for 1,433.90 sq km of deforested area.
Pará was the state with the highest deforestation rate (499.83 sq km) in the observation period.
The most affected city was Porto Velho, in the state of Rondônia, where 101.67 sq km of land were deforested.
The most affected Nature Protected Area in the month was the Chico Mendes Extractive Reserve, in the state of Acre, where 16.24 sq km of forest were lost.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) says that 367.59 sq km of forest were cleared across the Legal Amazon in March, 2021, which is a 199.37% increase from the previous month.
Those numbers represent a 12.44% increase in deforestation rate in March of the current year from the same month of the previous year.
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (361.13 sq km) was clear-cutting, which clears the soil of vegetation.
Pará was the state where there was the most impact of deforestation (166.67 sq km).
Novo Progresso was the most affected municipality (54.30 sq km).
The Jamanxim National Forest, in the state of Pará, was the most devastated Nature Protected Area in March, where deforestation amounted to 14.74 sq km.

paragraphs: Deforestation amounted to 2,255.45 sq km in the legal Amazon in July 2019, according to data from the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
Compared to the previous month, deforestation increased by 146.77%.
Amounting to 2,005.31 sq km, the main cause of land degradation was clear-cut deforestation, which completely clears the soil of vegetation, which removes all vegetation of the soil.
Pará was the most affected state, where 890.71 sq km were deforested.
Altamira was the most affected municipality (178.23 sq km).
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the the TAPAJÓS ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AREA, in the state of Pará, where 15.40 sq km of land were deforested.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that deforestation of the Legal Amazon amounted to 85.74 sq km in January 2021.
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (85.16 sq km) was clear-cut deforestation, which completely clears the soil of vegetation.

The state of Mato Grosso, where deforestation amounted to 44.58 sq km, was the most affected in January, and Altamira, state of Pará, was the municipality with the most deforestation (44.58 sq km) in the same period.
The most affected Nature Protected Area in the month was the Chico Mendes Extractive Reserve, in the state of Acre, where 0.09 sq km of forest were lost.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) reported that 122.79 sq km of land were deforested in the Legal Amazon in February 2021.
Compared to the previous month, deforestation increased by 43.21%.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of any vegetation, responsible for 120.58 sq km of deforested area.
Pará was the state with the highest deforestation rates (36.13 sq km) in the observation period.
The most affected municipality was Apui (9.02 sq km), in the state of Amazonas.
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the Saracá-Taquera National Forest, in the state of Pará, where 1.48 sq km of land were deforested.

paragraphs: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 185.76 sq km were chopped out of the legal Amazon in February 2020.
Responsible for 180.04 sq km of deforested area, the main cause of destruction was clear-cut deforestation, that leaves the soil clear of vegetation.
The most deforested state was Mato Grosso, where 74.93 sq km of forest were chopped of.
Marcelandia (in the state of Mato Grosso), where 36.51 sq km of forest were chopped out, ranked the worst in terms of deforestation.
The Acari National Park, in the state of Amazonas, was the most devastated Nature Protected Area in February, where deforestation amounted to 1.45 sq km.

paragraphs: An area of approximately 189.89 sq km was deforested in the Legal Amazon, in December 2019, according to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (183.39 sq km) was clear-cut deforestation, that leaves the soil clear of vegetation.
The state with the most deforestation in the month was Mato Grosso (76.46 sq km), and the most devastated municipality was Marcelandia / Mato Grosso, where deforestation amounted to 20.89 sq km.
The Jamanxim National Forest, in the state of Pará, was the most devastated Nature Protected Area in December, where deforestation amounted to 0.85 sq km.

paragraphs: An area of approximately 1,707 sq km was deforested in the Legal Amazon, in August 2019, according to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE).
Amounting to 1,671 sq km, the main cause of land degradation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of any vegetation, which removes all vegetation of the soil.
Pará was the state with the highest deforestation rates (820 sq km) in the observation period.
Sao Felix do Xingu was the most affected municipality (154 sq km).
In August, the most affected Nature Protected Area, where 22 sq km were cleared of vegetation, was the Jamanxim National Forest, in the state of Pará.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that deforestation of the Legal Amazon amounted to 1,451 sq km in September 2019.
Amounting to 1,434 sq km, the main cause of land degradation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the land clear of vegetation, which removes all vegetation of the soil.
Pará was the state with the highest deforestation rates (500 sq km) in the observation period.
The most affected municipality was Porto Velho (102 sq km), in the state of Rondônia.
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the the Chico Mendes Extractive Reserve, in the state of Acre, where 16 sq km of forest were chopped out.

paragraphs: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 563 sq km of forestland were deforested in the legal Amazon in November 2019.
Compared to the previous month, deforestation increased by 2%.
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (549 sq km) was the deforestation that clears all vegetation of the soil, called clear-cut deforestation.
The most deforested state was Pará, where 343 sq km of forest were chopped of.
The most affected city was Sao Felix do Xingu, in the state of Pará, where 31 sq km of land were deforested.
The most affected Nature Protected Area in October was the Jamanxim National Forest (in the state of Pará), where devastation amounted to 3 sq km.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) detected 190 sq km of forest clearing in the legal Amazon in December 2019.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) says that 284 sq km of forest were cleared across the Legal Amazon in January, 2020, which is a 50% increase from the previous month.
The main class of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of vegetation, responsible for 264 sq km of deforested area.
The most deforested municipality in the month was Paranatinga (26 sq km), in the state of Mato Grosso, and the most affected state overall was Mato Grosso (124 sq km).

paragraphs: According to the National Institute for Space Research (INPE), 186 sq km were chopped out of the legal Amazon in February 2020.
The main cause of destruction of the Amazon in the month (180 sq km) was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of vegetation.
The state with the most deforestation in the month was Mato Grosso (75 sq km), and the most devastated municipality was Marcelandia / Mato Grosso, where deforestation amounted to 37 sq km.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) reported that 326 sq km of forest were cleared across the Legal Amazon in March 2020, which represents a 76% increase from the previous month.
Responsible for 317 sq km of deforested area, the main cause of destruction was clear-cutting, which clears the soil of vegetation.
Pará was the most affected state, where 122 sq km were deforested.
Altamira, in the state of Pará was the most affected municipality, where 77 sq km were deforested.
The Nature Protected Area where there was the most deforestation was the Jamanxim National Forest, state of Pará, where 3 sq km of forest were chopped out.

paragraphs: The National Institute for Space Research (INPE) estimated that the deforestation of the legal Amazon amounted to 407 sq km in April 2020, which represents an increase of 25% compared to the previous month.
Those numbers represent a 17,100% increase in deforestation rate in April of the current year from the same month of the previous year.
The main cause of deforestation was clear-cut deforestation, which leaves the soil clear of vegetation, responsible for 393 sq km of deforested area.
Mato Grosso was the state with the highest deforestation rate (145 sq km) in the observation period.
Porto Velho (in the state of Rondônia), where 39 sq km of forest were chopped out, ranked the worst in terms of deforestation.
The Jamanxim National Forest, in the state of Pará, where deforestation amounted to 6 sq km, was the most affected Nature Protected Area in August.
